Description: Fragment from shoulder of pottery dinos(?); interior glazed; exterior, goats to right (foreparts of one, rear leg of second) with added red on the neck and much filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: The London Dinos Group
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 218, no. 54)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 110, pl. XXXIV, no. 321.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.13)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4681 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
